article_title: The Courage to Act, but Often Suboptimally
article_text: Regarding Peter Wallison’s “Bernanke and the Slow-Growth Crew” (op-ed, Nov. 5): In the postcrisis environment, most in Washington had a strong incentive to scapegoat Wall Street. Former Sen. Chris Dodd and former Rep. Barney Frank, champions of the federal government’s deleterious affordable-housing goals for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, had the honor of drafting new banking rules that punished Wall Street while leaving all stones unturned with regard to Washington’s role in incentivizing bad lending behavior, creating the housing...
